intro: Cyathochaeta teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cyathochaeta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
